comments.commentBody: Your polemicizing is ridiculous. Police shootings comprise only a tiny sliver of the lost life via homicides in the nation as a whole or in African-American communities or in poor communities. In African-American communities, orders of magnitude more youths and young adults are killed by their peers than by cops. If you want to prevent loss of life there, you begin by looking at the data, which show that cops are overwhelmingly reducing the number of such deaths overall, and go from there.  And while you're at it, look at the overall gun death numbers to see that nearly 2/3 of all gun deaths are suicides (although African-Americans are somewhat *under*represented proportionately in those grim numbers). If you are serious about preventing gun deaths overall, you must look at suicides first and foremost.
Why on earth do police departments need any of this military equipment?
Yup, just like he was wrong in 2000 and 2007.  But who needs data and a theory that can be tested against that data when they get in the way of your dreams of easy riches?

I don't think that he can take credit for 2007 melt down. It is very much due to sub-prime mortgage loan, not PE ratio. It this cycle turns out to be benign. He will take credit for it for PE not high enough. His PE did not predict the melt-down in early 70's, which lasted almost a decade. Please be critical on the data.

Josh:  CAPE in January 1966 was 24.06 and it was 7.39 by January of 1982.  Taking inflation into account, this sixteen year stretch was clearly sub-par (real price on the S&P went from 702 in January 1966 to 298 in January 1982).  Professor Shiller himself argues that CAPE is not a timing tool, but it does point out quite well long periods of likely over- or under-performance for stocks.  Investors ignore its current warning of poor stock market performance over the next decade at their peril.

Bob Schiller's PE ratio may not be relevant to the current market because it is an average of past 10 years P/E. If there is a current high valuation, it would be too diluted to be detected. If there is a low PE ratios 10 years ago, just pass off from inclusion in the calculation (such as 2002-2003), it may produce artificially high P/E. In short, it is not very useful for the quantification of the current market. If he assesses the current largely based on his P/E, he likely produces an error in judging the market value.

Bloviana - your name is well chosen, but your points are not.  Wilson, as so many have pointed out correctly, should have called for back up, and stayed in his car, which is exactly what well trained cops are taught to do.  Since he got out of his car after being 'humiliated' and shot the man who hit him (he says), and then shot him repeatedly, his judgement, and credibility is strained in my view, in fact it sounds like he's been coached by an attorney who's already told him he should look for a reduced sentence compromise.

Fair point.
I would only say, it might have been possible or it might have been impossible.
A lot is made over how big a guy Brown was, which is true. But we know nothing of the size and strength of the man who killed him because he is nowhere to be found.

It could have gone really bad for Officer Wilson. Nice kids "headed for college" sometimes kill officers attempting to take them into custody. Countless police officers have been murdered during routine contact under similar circumstances. It appears that Mr. Brown was very adroit at "taking more from a table than he brought" and may very well have been just that kind of guy.
By some accounts the cop pulled Brown closer to the car by grabbing his clothing near his neck.  Get the facts.

Officer Wilson must have some seriously large hands and forearm muscles to be able to grab the neck of a 300 lbs 6'4" man with one outstretched left hand out the window per Mr. Dorian Johnson's claim.  That is amazing.  To demonstrate how ridiculous this is, try to grab your thigh with your left hand and now lift your thigh up against your hand grip.
how do you know he didn't hit himself to justify the murder?  Was Brown's hand swollen or skin damaged?  I think that breaking an eye socket would be enough force to possibly injure his hand.

What happened to being innocent until proven guilty.

Probably what Brown was thinking to himself

Sorry, but I think you need to study history a bit more closely. When black slaves were brought from Africa, their children were sold out from under them. There was no such thing as a wife or a husband for a black slave, the other party could be sold and shipped away at any time. This kind of treatment does not exactly build strong family ties. Whether white or black, you will find that historical patterns of behavior have a strong influence now.

As for crime, it is, first off, an economic strategy for dealing with poverty. It is not a good strategy and it is completely unacceptable socially and otherwise, but we should keep in mind that we "white folks" have a way of classifying what we do as not criminal. Blacks are victims of crime by other black people much more so that whites.

No father in the home: that, in part, was encouraged by welfare programs that would pay more if there was no father present. We, as a society, rewarded people for not forming permanent marriage unions. We also rewarded mothers for having more babies. (Poor people of any race tend to have more children than the wealthy. It is often viewed as a blessing whereas people with more money see too many children as a burden, the reverse of economic reality, of course, except where careers are concerned.)

A lot of the back story helps to explain what happens up front that we all can see.

Thank the Good Lord that Michelle Obama has a short memory.  Otherwise she'd be so distressed from the past injustices inflicted on her people  that it would be hard for her to get out of bed in the morning to fix breakfast for Barrack.

Ravi:I like your basic approach--just want to point out that the 10 segment solution does have a sqrt(5) segment. The 12 segment solution manages to sneak in an additional sqrt(8) between 2 and 3 and an additional sqrt (13) between 3 and 4.

There is a "culture of discouragement" in the black community. This culture is handed down from father to son, mother to daughter. Underlying this culture of discouragement is one of the worst crimes any human being can commit against another, short of murder or rape, to deny a person's humanity and to do so on a society wide basis with laws used as a weapon.

There is also a pact of social cohesion within the black community not to aspire to "things white". If a black student does well and intends to attend an elite college, he will likely be cut off from peers. He will be taunted as wanting to be white rather than sharing the sense of oppression felt by everyone else. Who do you think you are? You think you're better than me?

This kind of social pact exists within many other subgroups as well. Working class white kids are not expected to go to Princeton and they, too, can be ostracized for having such aspirations. Their teachers, having not attended an elite school themselves (jealousy) can attempt to discourage the student and say it is impossible.

These facts just scratch the surface. We have a system of higher education that is designed of, by and for the wealthy classes. This system perpetuates advantage, which is exactly what it is supposed to do.

The strongest upward ladder for the poor is to have a family member who is successful and can pave the way to job opportunities. Without that, experience and resumes are just words on paper

http://terryreport.com

As whites become a minority in the US by 2050, who will the blacks blame then?  On the growing Asian and Hispanic population?  Time is running out for the black community and its victimhood narrative, and this is probably a good thing in the long run for the black community.
Excellent post, Ms. Long!

Jerry from LA is addressing timing, and everyone agrees the Ferguson police were criminal in their holding back releasing their ME's findings.  The DA in Ferguson it turns out has a very bad family history that predisposes him to take revenge on blacks.  And your criticism seems babbling and incoherent.
I'm sorry for your experience, but you should not be ideologically- or racially-blindered on this or any other case.  Wait for the investigation instead of prejudging based on an earlier experience.

I am moved by the list on the right, I am disturbed by the list on the left. But I bought a powershot last month, so I am on the left list.
Isn't there something we can do for the hinterlands of Maine, New Mexico, etc.? Not enough political will? Is it that bad that even political will is useless?
What does the search on the right, "deny me", mean? Is that a social services thing? Standard and Poors recently recommended "education" as the answer to end inequality. Some people incur huge debt because not everyone can pass college, and private scam magnets for financial aid promise, and then fold. If you are a liberal, you must help these people even though you consider them superstitious or a general burden. Holiday Greetings! For shame.

"This girl is 'Want', this boy is 'Ignorance', they cling to me for protection. Beware of them both. but mostly, beware of this boy." (Dickens)
Cops do go to trail for shooting blacks  and  some are convicted.  For example, Officer Johannes Mehserle was convicted for shooting Oscar Grant, a black man, in the Fruitvale Station incident.

would love to hear your tale of overcoming great poverty, family chaos, chronic disease- I'm sure its inspiring.

ps-I'm an MD in rural appalachia.
People still buy cameras?

In logical terms, this is called shooting the messenger.

Lying about a theft and lying about what he observed at this scene are not logically equivalent. Lying once does not mean habitual lair. If it did, no one would be a credible witness.

Mr. Bosley's penalty for mishandling funds does not measure his effectiveness to represent a client. Mishandling funds is not the same as adversarial incompetence.

Shooting the messenger(s) tips the bias in your hand, I'm afraid.
Except Johnson does seem to have lied in his version of events. At minimum, he claimed that Brown was shot in the back. The family's own medical examiner has said that is not the case.

If Mr Johnson testifies under oath before the grand jury, they will need to assess his credibility and be provided evidence unlike readers of this story. They should be told that Mr Johnson pleaded guilty in 2011 to giving false information to Jefferson City police after stealing a backpack, and a warrant is outstanding for his arrest since he did not show up in court. http://www.stltoday.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/key-witness-meets-wi...

In addition, Mr Freeman R. Bosley, Jr., who in this story recounts Mr Johnson's interview on MSNBC with Al Sharpton, might not be believed if he were to testify, as he admitted Dec. 9 that he mishandled client funds and a special state panel said his law license should be suspended for two years because his excuses were "not credible".

http://www.stltoday.com/lifestyles/columns/joe-holleman/missouri-wants-f...
Maybe they're searching for something, compelled by bigger questions, not so easily obtained (in any case, which don't come in an Amazon box).
Sexual terms are probably searched by people in both types of counties, so those terms would not show up on either of these lists.
You, like Obama, must be one of the tolerant and inclusive crowd...
Except it pretty much only happens to blacks.

Surely you jest. Look at the datum. Black men in America are far more likely to be killed, incarcerated, mistreated by our criminal justice system. Period.

It is a legalized Jim Crow system.
(but think statistics show far more like to lose it if you are black)

Both accounts are equally plausible.  Neither sounds like a racial problem.  When you are involved in an altercation with a policeman in a highly charged situation, you are putting your life on the line and risk losing it whether you are white or black

Does the $3.8 trillion you cite for M, M and SS include the payments made into M,M and SS? How much money is paid into these systems by citizens?  Are SS funds still being borrowed by the legislative branch of the government?
